question.text: What mass in miligram of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> is required to react completely with 25 ml of 0.75 M HCl according to the reaction <math><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?

solution.text:
Given
CaCO 3 (s) + 2HCl (aq) →  CaCl 2 (aq) +  CO 2 (g) +  H 2 O (l)
Moles present in 25 ml of 0.75 M HCl =0.751000×25
=0.01875 moles
Since 2 moles react completely with 1 mole  CaCO 3  = 100 g
0.01875 moles react completely with CaCO 3 = 100 2 ×0.01875
0.9375 g=937.5 mg
